intro: Tofieldia pusilla subsp. austriaca, commonly known as the Austrian dwarf heather, is a low-growing, mat-forming plant native to Central Europe. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes many shrubs and flowering plants adapted to acidic soils. The species is characterized by its dense clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodland floors and rocky slopes. Its compact size and ornamental flowers make it a popular choice for garden cultivation in suitable climates.
